Cat.randomFact: A cat can run to the speed of about 30 mph over short distances. This means that a cat can outrun superstar runner Usain Bolt in a 200 meter dash!

Leopard.randomFact: Leopards are renowned for their agility. They run up to 58km/h and can leap 6m horizontally and 3m vertically. They are also very strong swimmers.
Leopard.habitat: Tropical forests, Grassland plains, Deserts, and Alpine areas

Chimpanzee.randomFact: One of the chimpanzee calls is the "pant-hoot." Each individual has his or her own distinctive pant-hoot, so that the chimp can be identified with precision.
Chimpanzee.habitat: Savanna Woodlands, Grassland-forest mosaics and tropical moist forests

Tiger.randomFact: Cubs start learning to hunt at six months of age but stay with their moms until they are about 18 months old.
Tiger.habitat: Rain forests, Grasslands, Savannas and Mangrove swamps

Jellyfish.randomFact: Many jellyfish have bioluminescent organs which emit blue or green light.
Jellyfish.lifespan: 1-3 years. Some are claimed to be immortal.
Jellyfish.endangered: The vast majority are not endangered

Eagle.randomFact: Male bald eagles are smaller than females.
Eagle.habitat: Estuaries, large lakes, reservoirs, rivers, and some Seacoast

Fox.randomFact: A group of foxes is called a skulk or leash.
Fox.habitat: forested areas, though they are also found in mountains, grasslands and deserts

Highland Cattle.randomFact: Their long hair is actually an unusual double coat of hair- on the outside is the oily outer hair, the longest of any cattle breed, and it is covering a downy undercoat underneath.
